In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

India is the third largest countries among the countries from our continent. Not only it is vast its culture and traditions are the most ancient. As the country is vast it also holds a population limit which is the 2nd largest populated in the world. And with large populations we can expect may challenges in management of the countries' resources, development of the country along with the growing technology

Most important aspects for the development of the India is medical support, which we acquire from the various healthcare departments. They help us to support and sustain population suffering from the most basic support to health care to the most advance medicine for the treatable mutation. For basic support, most of the curable diseases are treated and taken care and when the mutations like cancer or worst are involved, the healthcare department can also offer the sophisticated infrastructure to deal with the situation.

Since the population is dynamic and the population stats keep changing the number of deserved people getting the treatment are far more lesser than the  actual population which requires the resources.

This difference is mainly 

  • Affordability of the medicine
  • Standard of living
  • Unavailability of effective medicine
  • Unavailability of effective staff and concerned manpower to deal with the presented situation 

The main reason for the ineffective administration of the resource happens when there is a huge demand for the product and the supply of that unit is not properly available to the management. This difference leads us to concentrate from the point of hiring manpower for the management to the effective utilization of the manpower. Most of the civilians have a common illusion and interpret is as the lack for proper management provided by the government. But the policies of the government are to offer adequate support and resources to the needy and to see that the people of India, get proper care.

For growing countries, problems as such are expected and are properly attended. To make the country stronger government needs to focus on:

  1. Management of food resources
  2. Management of proper guidance to the audience
  3. Transparency to the government policies
  4. Health care supply and  management
  5. To identify and treat the needy 
  6. Proper import and export policies
  7. Encouragement the innovative and creative approaches to the development of the healthcare
